titleStmt.title: Charles by the grace of God, King of Great Britaine ... forsomuch as our Estates of our kingdome of Scotland conveened in our generall convension holden at our pallace of Haly-rude-house, vpon the 28 day of Iulij ... haue made a free and willing offer of a yearelie extra-ordinarie taxation of the twentie pennie ...
titleStmt.author: Scotland. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A11699 of text S2320 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 21988). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 5 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 1 1-bit group-IV TIFF page image.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: Charles by the grace of God, King of Great Britaine ... forsomuch as our Estates of our kingdome of Scotland conveened in our generall convension holden at our pallace of Haly-rude-house, vpon the 28 day of Iulij ... haue made a free and willing offer of a yearelie extra-ordinarie taxation of the twentie pennie ...
titleStmt.author: Scotland. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

notesStmt.note: Second pt. of title from text.
"Giuen vnder our signet at our pallace of Haly-rude-house the 28 day of Iulij and of our raigne the sixt yeare, 1630."
Reproduction of original in the Town House (Aberdeen, Scotland). Charter Room.
